1433129793730531331.text:
President Biden stated, “My fellow Americans, the war in Afghanistan is now over.” 

The war is not over, and the withdrawal is not complete until we get EVERY single American citizen out of Afghanistan and back to the United States.

1433129604047413251.text: Yesterday, @POTUS addressed the nation sharing the “extraordinary success of this mission” when talking about our withdrawal from Afghanistan. How can he say that if we still have Americans trapped in Afghanistan?

1432789855835131907.text: To every American who served in Afghanistan, we thank you. You served admirably, and you represent the very best our country has to offer. Thank you for your service, and God Bless America.

1432789854207741957.text: I’d like to make this clear: for 20 years, the military did their job, and they did it well. We owe them our sincerest thanks and gratitude for their sacrifices and dedication to our country.

1432789852735553543.text: President Biden said the buck stops with him, and it sure does. The President needs to be held accountable for leaving Americans behind. The President needs to be held accountable for the decisions his Administration has made resulting in loss of life and the loss of security.

1432789850315493379.text:
The United States and the world are less secure because of the reckless decisions President Biden and his Administration have made. 
 
This is shameful.

1432789848797089795.text: Innocent Afghans were also killed. Our Afghan partners who have been essential to our presence in the country are now living in fear because of what the Taliban may do to them or their families as retribution for their support of our troops.

1432789847245271056.text: Tens of billions of dollars of equipment were left behind and are now in the hands of the Taliban. Last week, we lost 13 of our bravest citizens in a terrorist attack in Kabul, which was the deadliest attack on Americans in Afghanistan since 2011.

1432789845831831557.text: Leaving Americans behind is entirely unconscionable. This decision does not represent our values.

1432789844061827078.text: President Biden made the decision to leave Americans behind by not extending the deadline to withdraw from Afghanistan. We no longer have troops on the ground, yet there are American citizens who remain in Afghanistan and are trying to get out.

1225172083619127298.text: As Members of Congress, we were elected to come together in order to provide for a better and safer America. It’s time to uphold our commitments to our constituents and get back to work.

1225172082708959237.text: Drug prices are soaring, substance abuse continues to rob Americans of their futures, people in rural areas can’t access the Internet, our nation’s spending is out of control, and more.

1225172081572286464.text: At last, the most partisan impeachment process in the history of our country is over.  Although we cannot get back the time wasted on partisanship and politics, we must now focus our work on the challenges our nation is facing.

1225132070655217664.text: ✅The House passed the #PAWS4VetsTherapyAct this afternoon! This #bipartisan bill intro’d by @RepSteveStivers works to make sure more #vets have access to the benefits of service dogs to treat PTS.

1224906310493315073.text: From work to increasing access to the Internet in rural areas to guaranteeing we remain a global leader in the race to 5G, we must continue our work to ensure all Americans have the ability to participate in our booming 21st century economy.

1224906309713244161.text: Lastly, I completely agree that we are on a path to greater prosperity for Americans in every state.

1224906308689764352.text: Our #armedforcess deserve to have the resources they need in order to safely defend our country from increasingly dangerous global threats.

1224906307251118080.text: I am especially proud the @POTUS signed into law legislation that would provide resources to continue to rebuild military readiness, which included the greatest pay increase for our troops in a decade.

1224906305938378753.text: America’s greatest strength has been our strong military – the committed and selfless men and women who risk their lives in order to protect us and keep us safe.

1224906304831082497.text: I am proud to have supported the #USMCA in the House b/c it provides a much-needed revamp of NAFTA so that our country gets our fair share of the deal while prioritizing the American worker and supporting our manufacturers.

1224906303778238466.text: The @POTUS mentioned the significant wins #USMCA will deliver for our country – especially for manufacturers.

1224906302922678280.text: Since @POTUS was elected to office, 107,000 jobs have been created in Ohio alone, including 16,000 manufacturing jobs.

1224906301861453825.text: More Americans have joined the workforce and are able to create a better life for themselves and their families. Thanks to a number of policies championed by Republicans, our national unemployment rate is at a 50-year low.

1224906300473167872.text: Tonight’s #SOTU address reminded us why the United States of America is the greatest country in the world to live, work, and raise a family.  When we work together to put America’s hardworking taxpayers first, our communities benefit.

1174702128096579585.text: While the national abortion rate decline is welcome sign, the dramatic rise in use of the abortion pill should worry pro-life and pro-abortion activists alike. Government should have to balance its budget just like every family and business across this great country. I will continue to fight for solutions that grow our economy and improve life for Americans.

I am an original cosponsor of H.J.Res. 22, a balanced budget amendment.

1154752138741985280.text: I voted against the budget deal that raises the debt ceiling and increases government spending by $322 billion. Washington doesn’t have a revenue problem; it has a spending problem. Without spending reductions, I couldn’t support a debt ceiling increase.

1151888285263978497.text: Ignoring warning signs and recklessly raising the minimum wage to $15 hurts small businesses and their workers in Ohio and across America, and risks millions of people -- especially those on the margins -- losing their jobs.

1126619365749735426.text: If we want to decrease costs, increase access, and protect people with pre-existing conditions, we need health care solutions that encourage innovation -- not punish it.

1126619364998959105.text: I support protecting people with pre-existing conditions and have voted for legislation to do just that. What I cannot support is a misleading bill that puts a greater burden on our states and our already struggling health care system.

1126619364155899905.text: The innovation waivers targeted in this bill were created under the Obama admin and have been successfully utilized by states (including Democrat-led states) to lower premiums. At no point could these waivers be used to deny people coverage due to pre-existing conditions.

1126619363526750210.text: Today I voted against a bill that has nothing to do with pre-existing conditions. The inappropriately named Protecting Americans with Preexisting Conditions Act of 2019 strips away states’ ability to innovate in their health care systems.
